thread.title: UIL issues suspensions as punishment for attack against referee
thread.title_full: UIL issues suspensions as punishment for attack against referee | www.statesman.com

author: Rick Cantu
title: UIL issues suspensions as punishment for attack against referee
text:
Two high school football players from San Antonio who blind-sided a game official — and the assistant coach whose comments possibly precipitated the attack — have been banned from participating in University Interscholastic League events for the remainder of the 2015-16 school year.
The penalties were levied Thursday during a hearing before the UIL’s State Executive Committee, which was meeting for the third time to discuss an ugly incident that drew national attention to Texas high school football. The attack against football umpire Robert Watts came during the waning moments of John Jay High’s game at Marble Falls on Sept. 4.
